answerText: Cytosine [or cytidine][10] Cytosine is the main base that undergoes this chemical modification, which occurs at CpG islands in order to silence genes. In mismatch repair, this modification is used to distinguish the template strand from the new strand.
heading: Penn Bowl |2013 | 10 | 14 | Science | Biology | College
subject: Science
question: Question: The deamination of this pyrimidine base forms uracil, which is a common source of error during DNA replication or PCR. [10] Name this nitrogenous base that forms three hydrogen bonds with guanine.
